sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
Consider the below figure. It is given that CDE and EGH are two triangles where DC is parallel to EG . Also, \(CH : CE = 4 : 7 \). Now, 
itemize{}
\item Prove that \(\Delta CFH \sim \Delta EGH \)
\item Find CF if \(EG = 9 \)
\item If FH is parallel to DE , find ratio of areas of triangles CFH and CDE .
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Considering triangles CFH and EGH , we have
\[
	\angle CHF = \angle EHG
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle GEH 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\Delta CFH \sim \Delta EGH 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
It is given that
\[
	\frac{CH }{CE } = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{7 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 7 CH = 4 (CH + HE )
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 3 CH = 4 HE 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{CH }{HE } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{} }{\input[s3v3]{} }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{
As we already proved that $\Delta CFH \sim \Delta EGH $,}$$ 
\[
	\frac{CF }{EG } = \frac{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{} }{HE }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{CF }{9 } = \frac{4 }{3 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow CF = \input[s4v3]{}
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
It is given that FH is parallel to DE , so
\[
	\angle \input[s5v1]{}\input[s5v2]{}\input[s5v3]{} = \angle CDE 
\]
In triangles CFH and CDE , we got 
\[
	\angle C = \angle C 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta CFH \sim \Delta CDE 
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of }\Delta CFH }{\textrm{area of } \Delta CDE } = \frac{CH ^2}{CE ^2}
\]
\[
	= \frac{\input[s7v1]{} }{\input[s7v2]{} }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["F", "C", "H"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle CHF = \angle EHG${Vertically opposite angles}, and $\angle FCH = \angle GEH ${alternate interior angles}. "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [4, 4, 3], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification of $\frac{CH }{CE } = \frac{4 }{7 }$, we get $\frac{CH }{HE } \frac{4 }{3 }$"}, {"data": ["C", "H", 12.0], "text": "$$\text{Since, $$\Delta CFH \sim \Delta EGH $, therefore, $\frac{CF }{EG } = \frac{CH }{HE }$, and hence, $CF = 12.0 $.}$$"}, {"data": ["C", "F", "H"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle CFH = \angle CDE$,{corresponding angles are equal}. "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [16, 49], "text": "$$\text{$\frac{\textrm{area of }\Delta CFH }{\textrm{area of } \Delta CDE } = \frac{CH ^2}{CE ^2}= \frac{16 }{49 }$, as the ratio of the area of similar triangles is equal to the square of the ratio of the corresponding sides.}$$ "}]
